Add the specified block, and all of its predecessors, to the specified set, if it&#39;s not already in there.

Stop predecessor traversal when we reach StopBlock.

### insertUniqueBackedgeBlock() {#ae72984cd3577f73b7880883b12808a8c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static BasicBlock &#42; insertUniqueBackedgeBlock (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; Preheader, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &#42; LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssaupdater">MemorySSAUpdater</a> &#42; MSSAU)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This method is called when the specified loop has more than one backedge in it.

If this occurs, revector all of these backedges to target a new basic block and have that block branch to the loop header. This ensures that loops have exactly one backedge.

Definition at line <a href="#l00355">355</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopsimplify-cpp">LoopSimplify.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### separateNestedLoop() {#add9d8e7cc38ac083f42ce6873a8defdd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Loop &#42; separateNestedLoop (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; Preheader, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42; DT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &#42; LI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42; SE, bool PreserveLCSSA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumptioncache">AssumptionCache</a> &#42; AC, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryssaupdater">MemorySSAUpdater</a> &#42; MSSAU)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
If this loop has multiple backedges, try to pull one of them out into a nested loop.

This is important for code that looks like this:

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>: ... br cond, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>, Next ... br cond2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a>, Out

To identify this common case, we look at the PHI nodes in the header of the loop. PHI nodes with unchanging values on one backedge correspond to values that change in the &quot;outer&quot; loop, but not in the &quot;inner&quot; loop.

If we are able to separate out a loop, return the new outer loop that was created.

Definition at line <a href="#l00212">212</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopsimplify-cpp">LoopSimplify.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>
Simplify one loop and queue further loops for simplification.

Definition at line <a href="#l00475">475</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/loopsimplify-cpp">LoopSimplify.cpp</a>.

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- LoopSimplify.cpp - Loop Canonicalization Pass ----------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass performs several transformations to transform natural loops into a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// simpler form, which makes subsequent analyses and transformations simpler and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// more effective.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loop pre-header insertion guarantees that there is a single, non-critical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// entry edge from outside of the loop to the loop header.  This simplifies a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// number of analyses and transformations, such as LICM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loop exit-block insertion guarantees that all exit blocks from the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (blocks which are outside of the loop that have predecessors inside of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop) only have predecessors from inside of the loop (and are thus dominated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// by the loop header).  This simplifies transformations such as store-sinking</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that are built into LICM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass also guarantees that loops will have exactly one backedge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Indirectbr instructions introduce several complications. If the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// contains or is entered by an indirectbr instruction, it may not be possible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to transform the loop and make these guarantees. Client code should check</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that these conditions are true before relying on them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Similar complications arise from callbr instructions, particularly in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// asm-goto where blockaddress expressions are used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note that the simplifycfg pass will clean up blocks which are split out but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end up being unnecessary, so usage of this pass should not pessimize</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// generated code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If this loop has multiple backedges, try to pull one of them out into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a nested loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is important for code that looks like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  Loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     br cond, Loop, Next</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     br cond2, Loop, Out</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To identify this common case, we look at the PHI nodes in the header of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop.  PHI nodes with unchanging values on one backedge correspond to values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that change in the &quot;outer&quot; loop, but not in the &quot;inner&quot; loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If we are able to separate out a loop, return the new outer loop that was</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212" lineLink="#add9d8e7cc38ac083f42ce6873a8defdd"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;<a href="#add9d8e7cc38ac083f42ce6873a8defdd">separateNestedLoop</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;Preheader,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42;DT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfo">LoopInfo</a> &#42;LI,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42;SE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PreserveLCSSA,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Don&#39;t try to separate loops without a preheader.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Preheader)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Treat the presence of convergent functions conservatively. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transformation is invalid if calls to certain convergent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// functions (like an AMDGPU barrier) get included in the resulting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// inner loop. But blocks meant for the inner loop will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// identified later at a point where it&#39;s too late to abort the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transformation. Also, the convergent attribute is not really</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sufficient to express the semantics of functions that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// affected by this transformation. So we choose to back off if such</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a function call is present until a better alternative becomes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// available. This is similar to the conservative treatment of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// convergent function calls in GVNHoist and JumpThreading.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;BB : L-&gt;blocks()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If ScalarEvolution is around and knows anything about values in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check to see that no blocks (other than the header) in this loop have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predecessors that are not in the loop.  This is not valid for natural</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// block, attempt to merge the exits. This helps several passes, such</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as LoopRotation, which do not support loops with multiple exits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SimplifyCFG also does this (and this code uses the same utility</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function), however this code is loop-aware, where SimplifyCFG is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// not. That gives it the advantage of being able to hoist</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop-invariant instructions out of the way to open up more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// opportunities, and the disadvantage of having the responsibility</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to preserve dominator information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> HasUniqueExitBlock = &#91;&amp;&#93;() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;UniqueExit = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;ExitingBB : ExitingBlocks)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;SuccBB : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a26e2a938b431eaa6eca2beaa96410c9d">successors</a>(ExitingBB)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (L-&gt;contains(SuccBB))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!UniqueExit)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><span class="doxyHighlight">          UniqueExit = SuccBB;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (UniqueExit != SuccBB)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (HasUniqueExitBlock()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;ExitingBlock : ExitingBlocks) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!ExitingBlock-&gt;getSinglePredecessor()) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst">BranchInst</a> &#42;BI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;BranchInst&gt;</a>(ExitingBlock-&gt;getTerminator());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!BI || !BI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst/#a7e4be8b16fbd68c9045a388904044e01">isConditional</a>()) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst">CmpInst</a> &#42;CI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;CmpInst&gt;</a>(BI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/branchinst/#aebd4af5642453ce3169094f08dd3d7b8">getCondition</a>());</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to hoist out all instructions except for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// comparison and the branch.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="660"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Success. The block is now dead, so remove it from the loop,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Worklist maintains our depth-first queue of loops in this nest to process.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Loop &#42;, 4&gt;</a> Worklist;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Worklist.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(L);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Walk the worklist from front to back, pushing newly found sub loops onto</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the back. This will let us process loops from back to front in depth-first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// order. We can use this simple process because loops form a tree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Idx = 0; Idx != Worklist.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>(); ++Idx) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L2 = Worklist&#91;Idx&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Worklist.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a7efd1f0c1206d95e4fe01a9b49a57b82">append</a>(L2-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#af2f81059dc7566164b018aac6555eb1a">begin</a>(), L2-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopbase/#a98eb0888f30e7a27151a7b02fa053205">end</a>());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Worklist.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#ad9a3c7bc26b130377bbafc170b5f88a2">empty</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> |= <a href="#ad54a3c6c671e583284ff935bfde3368c">simplifyOneLoop</a>(Worklist.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a0c8ffe664a36e30d49c84d0aded2fe08">pop&#95;back&#95;val</a>(), Worklist, DT, LI, SE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               AC, MSSAU, PreserveLCSSA);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Changing exit conditions for blocks may affect exit counts of this loop and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// any of its parents, so we must invalidate the entire subtree if we&#39;ve made</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// any changes. Do this here rather than in simplifyOneLoop() as the top-most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop is going to be the same for all child loops.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as loop passes destroy this analysis. That&#39;s actually fine, but we have no</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopinfobase/#aea4b1950342e503aa8a2904f30ec7331">LoopInfo::iterator</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = LI-&gt;begin(), E = LI-&gt;end(); <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> != E; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>)</span></CodeLine>
